title: Transit delays, higher costs: Bangladesh garment import curbs to hit buyers
content: India is restricting ready-made garment imports from Bangladesh via land. This action is expected to raise logistics costs. Transit times will also increase. Apparel Export Promotion Council notes potential negative impacts. A significant portion of apparel imports enters India through land ports. The change will affect shipments through Petrapole land port. Ships will now sail to Kolkata and Mumbai.

title: Constitution is supreme, all its wings must work together: CJI
content: CJI Bhushan Gavai emphasized the Constitution's supremacy, stating that all three branches—judiciary, executive, and legislature—must collaborate within its framework. His statement follows President Murmu's reference to the SC regarding timelines for governors and the President in handling state bills. Justice Gavai highlighted the 'basic structure' doctrine, limiting Parliament's amendment powers.

title: Ex-US President Biden diagnosed with 'aggressive' prostate cancer
content: Former President Joe Biden, 82, has been diagnosed with prostate cancer after a routine physical exam revealed a nodule. Doctors confirmed the cancer has spread to his bones but is hormone-sensitive, allowing for effective management. Biden and his family are reviewing treatment options, adding to his medical history that includes past skin cancer treatments and public scrutiny over his health.

title: Shreyas Iyer creates IPL history – no captain has ever done this before
content: Punjab Kings secured a playoff berth by defeating Rajasthan Royals. Nehal Wadhera and Shashank Singh scored half-centuries. Harpreet Brar took three wickets. Shreyas Iyer became the first captain to lead three different teams into the IPL playoffs. Punjab posted 219 for 5. Rajasthan Royals managed 209 for 7 in reply.

title: Pakistan's China-borrowed air defence system remained unused: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced that Operation Sindoor successfully dismantled terrorist infrastructure within Pakistan, exposing Islamabad's denial of harboring terrorism. Indian forces penetrated deep into Pakistani territory, obliterating terrorist hubs in Pakistan and PoK after the Pahalgam attack. The operation, enabled by strong political will and military precision, sent a clear message that terrorism and trade cannot coexist.

title: US Embassy in India issues warning of permanent ban on traveling: If you...
content: The U.S. Embassy in India has issued a warning about the consequences of overstaying visas. Indian citizens traveling to the U.S. on work, student, or tourist visas risk deportation and a permanent ban if they remain beyond their authorized stay.

title: EXPLAINED: MI, DC and LSG in brutal race for IPL 2025 playoffs
content: Gujarat Titans, Royal Challengers Bengaluru, and Punjab Kings have secured their spots in the IPL 2025 playoffs. Gujarat Titans lead the table with 18 points, followed closely by RCB and PBKS with 17 each. The battle for the fourth playoff spot intensifies, with Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, and Lucknow Super Giants vying for the final position.

title: There’s no ‘expiry date’ for pause in military hostilities: Army on Pak
content: Indian Army clarifies that the ceasefire understanding with Pakistan has no expiry date. This follows India's precision strikes on Pakistani airbases. India emphasizes the truce depends on Pakistan's behavior. No further talks are scheduled between the DGMOs of both countries. India maintains a pause in Operation Sindoor. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh warns of harsh punishment if Pakistan disturbs peace.

title: 'He is the reason we're here': Shubman Gill's emotional words
content: Gujarat Titans secured their IPL 2025 playoff spot with a dominant 10-wicket victory over Delhi Capitals, fueled by Shubman Gill and Sai Sudharsan's unbeaten heroics. Sudharsan's 108 and Gill's 93 led a flawless chase of 200, showcasing their strong partnership and securing Gujarat's qualification with two matches to spare. Reflecting on his captaincy journey, Gill admitted to early struggles in the role but said he has since learned how to handle the pressure.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of its Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: 17 of jeweller’s family, 8 kids among them, die in Hyderabad fire
content: A devastating fire engulfed a century-old building near Charminar in Hyderabad, claiming the lives of 17 members of a jeweller's family. The victims, spanning three generations, had gathered for a weekend. The blaze, suspected to be caused by an electrical short circuit, rapidly spread through the residential-cum-commercial building, trapping the family due to a single narrow exit.

title: Know the 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning' box office collection
content: Tom Cruise's Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning had a great start in India. The film earned Rs 33 crore in two days. It became the highest-grossing Hollywood film opening of 2025. The movie surpassed Final Destination Bloodlines and Thunderbolts. Strong bookings and Cruise's popularity helped. The film's success gave a boost to the Indian box office.

title: FPIs, India-US trade news to dictate Dalal-Street movement
content: Indian markets are poised to react to foreign fund activity, developments in the India-US trade deal, and the rupee-dollar exchange rate following Moody's US credit rating downgrade. Investors will also be watching quarterly earnings from major companies like ONGC and ITC. Strong participation from both FIIs and DIIs, coupled with global risk appetite, has fueled the recent market rally.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6k laid off employees: 'These are people …'
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: Wayne Gretzky’s daughter stuns in new photos and leaves fans in awe
content: Paulina Gretzky, daughter of Wayne Gretzky, is currently supporting her husband Dustin Johnson at the PGA Championship. She recently shared stunning pictures on social media. Fans admired her beauty in the photos. Wayne Gretzky was also seen with Paulina and Dustin at a Florida Panthers game. This marks Wayne Gretzky's second public appearance after a controversy.

title: Operation Blackforest marks ‘beginning of end of Naxalism’: CRPF DG
content: Security forces aim to eliminate Naxalism before March 2026. Operation Blackforest saw success with coordinated efforts. Forces eliminated 31 Maoists. Anti-Naxal operations continue in multiple states. Maoists are requesting ceasefire and dialogue. Surrenders have increased this year. Operations will continue during the monsoon. Forces are confident to locate and neutralise Maoists. Maoists may resort to desperate attacks.

title: Didn’t ask Congress for names for foreign outreach: Govt
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju refuted Congress's claims that the government rejected their MP nominations for anti-terror outreach delegations. Rijiju clarified that informing Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge was merely a courtesy, not a request for nominations. He emphasized that seeking party recommendations for such delegations has never been a standard practice.

title: Nicusor Dan wins Romanian presidential race, defeats George Simion
content: Nicusor Dan, a pro-European figure, has won Romania's presidential election with 54% of the vote, defeating nationalist George Simion. Dan campaigned on promises of change, rebuilding Romania, and aligning it with a pro-Western path. He aims to combat corruption and modernize the country, focusing on economic development and foreign policy.

title: Reforms plans at risk if you up tension with India: IMF to Pakistan
content: Despite India's strong opposition, the IMF has approved fresh assistance to Pakistan, raising concerns about potential risks. The IMF highlighted that heightened tensions with India could impede Pakistan's reform efforts. It also cautioned about reputational risks due to possible fund diversion, echoing India's concerns about the misuse of funds for rebuilding terror bases.

title: 1st time in 8 yrs, Isro workhorse PSLV fails on 101st launch; sat lost
content: In a setback for the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro), the PSLV-C61 mission failed after liftoff from Sriharikota on Sunday. The rocket malfunctioned during its third stage, preventing the EOS-09 satellite from reaching its intended orbit. Isro Chairman V Narayanan cited a drop in chamber pressure within the solid motor as the cause.

title: Stalin urges 8 non-BJP CMs to unite against Centre on governor power
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has requested support from eight non-BJP state leaders. He wants a united legal challenge. This challenge is against the President's reference to the Supreme Court. The reference concerns the powers of governors. Stalin fears this move weakens state autonomy. He believes it undermines the federal structure of the Constitution.

title: 70 Pak drones destroyed in Gujarat, Rajasthan during Operation Sindoor
content: Indian Air Force and Southern Command successfully neutralised around 70 Pakistani drones. This included a Turkish-origin Songar armed drone. Operation Sindoor took place in Bhuj, Naliya, Gujarat and Rajasthan. Lt Gen Dhiraj Seth assessed the security situation in Rann Of Kutch. Recovered drone wreckage was shown to the commander. Army and IAF units use various air defence systems.

title: Scottie Scheffler net worth: How much is the world's top ranked golfer worth?
content: Scottie Scheffler is the world's top golfer. He had a great 2024 season with many wins and big earnings. Scheffler won the FedEx Cup and an Olympic gold medal. He also makes money from investments and endorsements. Scheffler lives in Dallas with his family. He continues to dominate golf in 2025. His net worth is estimated to be very high.

title: Overstaying in US? You risk deportation, entry ban
content: The US embassy warns of strict action against visa overstays. Foreigners risk deportation and a permanent US entry ban. International visitors staying over 30 days must register. This advisory comes amid rising Indian travel to America. The US is intensifying efforts against visa fraud and illegal immigration. New visa curbs apply to those facilitating illegal immigration.

title: Woman’s body found with arms around 4 children in Hyderabad inferno
content: In a devastating fire in Hyderabad's Gulzar Houz neighbourhood, seventeen members of a jeweller's family perished. First responders discovered the charred body of an elderly woman embracing four children, highlighting her desperate attempt to shield them from the flames. The heartbreaking scene left rescuers deeply affected, underscoring the tragedy's profound impact.

title: Trump Jr’s buddy pushes group’s biz in Pak, Bangladesh & Turkiye
content: Donald Trump Jr.'s associate, Gentry Beach, visited Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Turkey, promoting potential deals in rare earth minerals, oil & gas, and real estate. He briefed Donald Trump Sr. on Pakistan's potential, leading to meetings with Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif. Beach's activities raise concerns about leveraging connections for financial gain, similar to past controversies involving Trump Jr.

title: Fans furious as Ross celebrates Brown after Miami event 'shooting'
content: Miami witnessed chaos during Adin Ross's boxing event. Antonio Brown, ex-NFL player, was allegedly involved in a shooting. Videos circulated online showing a physical altercation. Claims suggest Brown fired shots amid a scuffle, possibly over a stolen chain. While arrest details are unconfirmed, Adin Ross voiced support for Brown. MarkyNextDoor is also under investigation.

title: Factory owner, 87, toddler grandson among 8 killed in Maha factory blaze
content: A devastating fire at a textile factory in Maharashtra's Solapur district claimed eight lives, including a toddler and the factory's owner. The blaze, suspected to be caused by an electrical short circuit, trapped families living on-site. Rescue efforts were hampered by a structure near the entrance, and firefighters faced intense flames and smoke while recovering bodies throughout the day.

title: For those falsely accused of conversion, fear doesn’t end with an acquittal
content: India's anti-conversion laws, intended to prevent forced religious conversions, are under scrutiny as the Supreme Court reviews their legality. Numerous individuals, like Sonu Saroj and Nadeem, have faced harassment, arrest, and prolonged legal battles under these laws, even after acquittal. Victims recount violence, social stigma, and lasting fear, highlighting the laws' impact on religious freedom and personal lives.

title: Puri vlogger linked to held Haryana YouTuber visited Kartarpur recently
content: A YouTuber from Puri is under investigation for potential ties to Haryana travel blogger Jyoti Malhotra, arrested on suspicion of spying for Pakistan. The inquiry was initiated after the Puri woman's Kartarpur Corridor trip following Jyoti's Puri visit. While her parents assert her innocence and pledge cooperation, authorities are investigating the nature of their relationship.

title: Key Lashkar operative behind terror strikes in India shot dead in Pak
content: Abu Saifullah, a key Lashkar-e-Taiba operative involved in multiple terror attacks in India, was killed in Pakistan's Sindh province. He oversaw LeT operations in Nepal, recruiting cadres and providing logistical support. Saifullah, known for deploying jihadis in disguise, had close ties to LeT's launch commander and was recently fundraising for Gaza.

title: Five more Bangladeshis rounded up in Uttarakhand
content: Dehradun police arrested five Bangladeshi nationals, including a woman, for illegally residing in Clement Town without valid documents. They claimed to have fled Bangladesh due to persecution fears following political unrest. A local woman was also arrested for aiding their stay, while their children were placed in a shelter home.

title: DGCA tells flying schools to maintain updated sites
content: India's aviation regulator, DGCA, has mandated that all flying training organizations (FTOs) maintain dedicated websites with updated information. This reform aims to bring transparency and empower aspiring commercial pilots to make informed choices. The websites must display key parameters like completion time for 200 flying hours, aircraft availability, instructor details, and simulator access.

title: HC cites wife's adultery, overturns order granting her maintenance
content: Chhattisgarh High Court overturned a family court's order for a husband to pay maintenance to his estranged wife, citing her adulterous conduct. The court referenced a divorce decree that was granted based on the wife's adultery, disqualifying her from receiving maintenance under CrPC section 125(4). The wife's plea for increased maintenance was also dismissed.

title: Retaliatory curbs may hit Dhaka’s export edge, hurt Indian buyers too
content: India is restricting ready-made garment imports from Bangladesh by land. This action will likely raise logistics costs and increase transit times. The move follows restrictions imposed by Bangladesh on Indian goods. Indian companies had set up units in Bangladesh for lower production costs. Dhaka's growing ties with China are also a concern.

title: NSA Ajit Doval, Iranian counterpart discuss bilateral ties
content: NSA Ajit Doval and Iranian security council secretary Ali Akbar Ahmadian discussed expanding cooperation, particularly on Chabahar Port and the INSTC. Ahmadian highlighted the deep-rooted ties and potential for collaboration, emphasizing the importance of strategic projects for regional peace. The conversation occurred after heightened tensions between India and Pakistan, with Iran offering assistance in de-escalation.

title: Cattle smugglers run over UP cop; 1 killed in encounter
content: In Uttar Pradesh, a cattle smuggler was killed and two others injured in Jaunpur after a police constable was crushed to death during a vehicle chase. Simultaneously, in Varanasi, police arrested four cattle smugglers following another encounter, with two sustaining leg injuries from retaliatory gunfire after attempting to flee with 24 cattle in a truck.

title: Policy soon for easy liquidation of cooperatives: Amit Shah
content: Union Minister Amit Shah announced a new policy for faster liquidation of defunct PACS and registration of new ones, targeting two lakh new PACS by 2029. These PACS will engage in 22 business activities to ensure financial stability, including cooperative-owned manufacturing units and circular economy initiatives in the dairy sector.

title: Man who lost leg in bus accident near Pune awarded Rs 1 crore
content: Abhijit Pujare, a Nalasopara resident, received compensation of approximately Rupees one crore. He lost his leg when his bus crashed near Pune in 2021. The Motor Accident Claims Tribunal ordered the compensation. RN Cabs Pvt Ltd and United India Insurance Co Ltd will jointly pay the amount. The accident occurred due to the bus driver's rash driving.

title: Hospital superbug ‘eating’ medical plastics, devices & implants: Study
content: A new study reveals that Pseudomonas aeruginosa, a common hospital bacteria in India, can degrade medical-grade plastic. This bacteria breaks down materials used in sutures and implants. Researchers isolated an enzyme, Pap1, that degraded 78% of a plastic sample in a week. The bacteria can also consume plastic as its only food source.

title: Mehbooba, Omar talk peace from warzone
content: Mehbooba Mufti advocated for a permanent ceasefire along the Pakistan border in J&K, emphasizing humanitarian relief for civilians affected by artillery fire and drone incursions. Omar Abdullah echoed the call for peace, criticizing the disconnect between war rhetoric and the reality faced by border residents. Both leaders urged prioritizing the safety and well-being of civilians in conflict zones.

title: Now, Mayawati names nephew BSP’s chief national coordinator
content: Mayawati has reinstated her nephew, Akash Anand, as the chief national coordinator of the BSP, just over a month after he was brought back into the party. This decision, announced during an all-India meeting, signals a move towards decentralization within the party. Akash pledged his loyalty and commitment to the BSP's mission, expressing gratitude to Mayawati for the opportunity.

title: J&K police hunt targets ‘terror ecosystem’
content: In a bid to dismantle terrorist networks, J&K police conducted extensive searches at multiple locations in Poonch, targeting overground workers who provide crucial support to terrorists. Simultaneously, the State Investigation Agency (SIA) raided locations in Kashmir, focusing on sleeper cell networks and seizing incriminating material. Authorities also detained alleged terrorist associates under the Public Safety Act.

title: Army neutralises 42 unexploded Pak shells in Poonch
content: The Indian Army and J&K police safely neutralised 42 unexploded Pakistani shells in Poonch. These shells targeted civilian areas after India's strikes on terrorist camps. An unexploded mortar shell was also destroyed in Samba district. The Army's bomb disposal squads carried out controlled explosions. The operations eliminated risks to civilian lives and property. Authorities followed safety protocols during the process.

title: Vigilance set to expand probe into ‘trap case’ involving ED official
content: The agency is poised to summon for questioning the ED official allegedly involved in the ‘bribe-for-legal reprieve’ plan. Official sources say the criminal operation seems entrenched and not a one-off offence.

title: Modi govt. continues to ignore V-P's pleas on behalf of farmers: Ramesh's dig on Dhankhar's birthday
content: Earlier this month, the Congress leader had cited Vice-President’s remark that inflation should be considered while providing aid to farmers to take a swipe at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, asking why he had not done so.

title: Crackdown on fake doctors in Nalgonda; TGMC files FIRs against 14 clinics
content: The accused, many of whom were previously employed as compounders, were allegedly providing unauthorised medical treatments, including administering antibiotics, steroids, and painkiller injections

title: Falcon scam: Telangana CID nabs two family members of absconding accused in Bihar
content: The CID recovered incriminating evidence including ₹8 lakh in cash, high-value fixed deposits, gold jewellery, mobile phones, electronic devices, passports, bank cards and property documents

title: Heritage, hospitality and a heartfelt message: Miss World contestants get a taste of Telangana
content: Inside the TGICCC, contestants were introduced to the technological marvels that support the city’s emergency response systems

title: Two Telugu veterans on 34-foot sailboat chart course from Kiwi coast to Visakhapatnam
content: Their sailboat is currently registered in Poland but is expected to switch to Indian registration upon arrival in Visakhapatnam later this year

title: Kerala Police initiates inquiry into alleged custodial harassment of Dalit woman at Peroorkada police station
content: While the woman was booked under Section 306 (theft by a clerk or servant) of the BNS, it is now deemed that the accusation was false

title: Diplomatic outreach revives memories of ‘dream teams’ that got India out of tight corners
content: The regional and domestic situation quickly morphed into a diplomatic challenge for India when the West powers and human rights watchdogs turned rights into a major tool of diplomacy

title: Hyderabad and Amaravati will emerge as top two cities in future: Chandrababu Naidu
content: Telugu people are a symbol of economic creativity and will be at the forefront when India emerges as the world’s leading economy by 2047, says CM

title: Masula Beach Festival to be celebrated at Manginapudi Beach from June 6 to 8
content: The beach is being decked up for the festival, and cultural programmes, book stalls, beach kabaddi and other competitions will be arranged, says Excise Minister Kollu Ravindra

title: Over 42 unexploded shells from recent cross-border artillery firing destroyed in J&K’s Poonch
content: Indian Army safely neutralises 42 unexploded ordnances in border areas, ensuring civilian safety and normalcy in conflict zones

title: Uphill task ahead for government gearing up to implement free bus travel scheme for women
content: APSRTC may have to allocate 7,930 buses from its fleet for the free bus travel, induct 2,045 additional buses and recruit 11,479 additional staff, including 5,016 drivers, 5016 conductors and 1,447 maintenance staff

title: 70 applications received for scheme to produce electronic components
content: Sources have said earlier that Tata Electronics, Dixon Technologies, and Foxconn were among the big players that have shown interest.

title: Thoothukudi’s furniture park remains largely unoccupied three years after its launch
content: Raising concern over the slow development of the park, investors cite problems with electricity and water facilities and inadequate promotional activity from the State government as the reasons

title: Adani partners with Sparton to develop anti-submarine warfare solutions
content: The partnership aims to localise the production and assembly of complex electronic sensors, navigation systems, and ASW solutions in India under the ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ and ‘Make in India’ initiatives, reducing India’s dependence on imports and foreign OEMs for critical naval technologies

title: West Bengal police issue summons to protesting teachers for damaging government property
content: The police resorted to baton charge to clear the teachers who were protesting the cancellation of appointments of about 26,000 teachers outside Bikash Bhawan on May 15

title: The tussle for temple turf
content: West Bengal’s newly built Jagannath Dham, constructed at a cost of ₹250 crore in the coastal town of Digha as a replica of the 12th-century Jagannath Temple in Puri, Odisha, has triggered a row between the two States, finds Shiv Sahay Singh. The temple has cultural and religious significance for those in India’s east, but is also being politically pushed as a counter to what is perceived as the BJP’s ‘north Indian’ Lord Ram

title: Hyderabad Gulzar Houz fire accident: CM Revanth Reddy orders probe into fire accident, commends fire personnel
content: The Chief Minister also commended the Fire Services authorities for their prompt response averting heavy loss of lives in the fire incident

title: Jaishankar to visit Netherlands, Denmark and Germany
content: S. Jaishankar will meet the leadership of the three countries and hold discussions with his counterparts on the entire gamut of bilateral relations, regional and global matters of mutual interest

title: Saroj Ghose, father of India’s science museum movement, passes away
content: The founding Director General of the National Council of Science Museums served in that capacity from 1979 to 1997

title: Two ‘radicalised youth’ arrested by Vizianagaram police
content: The accused, natives of Hyderabad and Vizianagaram, were making bombs and involved in anti-national activities, police officials said

title: Gulzar Houz fire accident: Pearl traders’ legacy burnt to ashes, 17 from three generations killed
content: On Saturday evening, the entire family had attended a function with Pankaj’s elder brother Govind, who now lives in Attapur. He had urged them to stay the night. But they returned home around 11 p.m.

title: Supreme Court directs States, Union Territories to reclaim reserved forests allotted to private parties
content: Court declares as illegal the allotment of 11.89 hectares of reserve forest land in Pune for agricultural purposes in 1998 and its sale to a builder the very next year

title: Catholic Congress reasserts relevance of Church leadership
content: Catholic Congress’ international conference takes place in Palakkad. Christians in Kerala will present a united front on key issues, says Thalassery Archbishop Mar Joseph Pamplany

title: Special Supervisory Officer appointed for Animal Welfare in Eluru district
content: The Special Supervisory Officer has been appointed as per the orders of the A.P. High Court and the guidelines of the Animal Welfare Board, to prevent the illegal transportation and slaughter of animals

title: Govt. clears Munnuru-Palair link canal with ₹162 crore to stabilise 2.54 lakh acres ayacut
content: Minister Uttam Reddy examines Bette Thand, Janpahad LI schemes in Suryapet district taken up with ₹304 crore

title: BRS flays govt. for its over-dependency on revenue from liquor sales
content: Party leader Harish Rao says Congress had promised to control liquor flow, but now it’s planning to allow 100 micro breweries

title: Gogoi dismisses Assam CM’s allegations as lies and slander
content: Gaurav Gogoi trashes Himanta Biswa Sarma’s accusation that he visited Pakistan at the invitation of the Inter-Services Intelligence

title: AIMPLB to resume its demonstrations against the Waqf Act
content: The Board had temporarily suspended its protests in solidarity with the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Listen to your conscience, Congress tells its leaders picked by government for all-party delegations
content: The Congress has accused the BJP-led government of playing ‘cheap political games’ by picking just one of the four names nominated by the party for the delegations, but including four other Congress leaders whom the party did not nominate

title: Six ministers review arrangements for TDP’s maiden Mahanadu in Kadapa
content: Party had won a majority of seats in the undivided Kadapa during the general elections last year, thus gaining strength in the district, which had been a bastion of the YSR family for four decades

title: Travel vlogger arrested for espionage was being groomed by Pakistani officials as an ‘asset’: Hisar Police
content: Jyoti Rani was in touch with more YouTube influencers and attended social gatherings of Pakistani intelligence officials, say police

title: Work hard to win KMC polls, Minister Bharath tells party leaders
content: Minister T. G. Bharath has asked party leaders and aspiring candidates to begin groundwork immediately and build strong connections with people

title: Kalaignar University will function temporarily on govt. college campus in Kumbakonam: Minister
content: Sources say arts and science colleges in Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Ariyalur and Nagapattinam are expected to be brought under the jurisdiction of the Kalaignar University

title: Pinarayi blames Centre for slashing SC/ST education funds
content: Chief Minister says his government will initiate schemes to ensure that the SC/ST communities are not left behind in Kerala’s development journey

title: Pakistan to send diplomatic delegation abroad to counter India's global outreach
content: Former Foreign Minister and head of the Pakistan People’s Party (PPP), Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, will head the delegation

title: Left-wing groups reject charges of government interference in KTU
content: Controversy centres around a government inquiry into the alleged denial of PhD admission to a former Syndicate member of the university

title: Munambam petitions to be heard afresh under old Waqf Act
content: A new judicial officer is set to assume charge as chairperson of Waqf Tribunal this week. The Waqf Act 1995 will continue to govern the cases as the acts challenged before the tribunal took place much before the enactment of Waqf Amendment Act 2025

title: Steps in place to revive past glory of Agriculture Department, says Sarvepalli MLA
content: Somireddy points out that the TDP-led alliance government has restarted the scheme to distribute farm equipment on subsidy to farmers

title: Eight killed in garment factory fire accident in Maharashtra’s Solapur district
content: The deceased individuals include the factory owner, identified as Haji Usman Hasanbhai Mansuri, three members of his family including his one-and-a-half-year old grandson, and four workers.

title: Permanant solution promised to flooding of farmlands in Nidadavole
content: The assurance comes in the wake of the 2024 Godavari floods, which caused flooding of the Yerrakaluva river, resulting in the inundation of vast stretches of paddy fields in the Nidadavole assembly

title: Curbs on imports from Bangladesh impact Tripura
content: All-Tripura Merchant Association, however, says the restrictions will have a brief impact as the items imported from Bangladesh are also available in India

title: India to apprise FATF of the latest evidence on terror infrastructure in Pakistan
content: The gruesome killings in Pahalgam have necessitated the sharing of information about the existing terror infrastructure in Pakistan with the international watchdog, a government official said

title: Former US President Joe Biden Diagnosed With Aggressive Prostate Cancer
content: United States' former President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with an "aggressive" form of prostate cancer that has spread to his bones, the Democrat's office announced on Sunday.

title: 25-Year-Old Krutrim Techie Found Dead In Bengaluru, Toxic Work Culture Blamed
content: Nearly two weeks after the body of a 25-year-old engineer was found in Agara Lake, allegations have surfaced on Reddit and media reports quoting unnamed employees that the engineer died by suicide due to toxic work culture.

title: Argument With Drunk Neighbour Leads To 3 Deaths In Mumbai:Cops
content: Enmity between two families in Mumbai's Ganpat Patil Nagar escalated this evening, leading to violent clashes that ended in the death of three persons and injury to four others.

title: Soldier Dies Of Bullet Injury From Own Rifle In J&K's Samba DIstrict
content: An army personnel died of a bullet injury from his service rifle inside a post near the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district on Sunday, officials said.

title: 30,000 Secretly Grown Marijuana Plants Destroyed In Turkey: Report
content: Turkey's drug squad has destroyed 30,000 marijuana plants being secretly grown in a vast terraced garden by the Tigris River that is on the UN Cultural Heritage list, media reports said on Sunday.

title: Lashkar Terrorist Abu Saifullah, Masterminded Of Key Attacks In India, Killed
content: A key terrorist of Lashkar E Taiba -- -- Rajullah Nizamani alias Abu Saifullah - has been shot dead in Pakistan's Sindh. Saifullah -- said to be involved in the attack on the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh headquarters in Nagpur in 2006 -- was shot dead

title: Video: No AC Inside Air India Plane In Delhi, Passenger Shares Ordeal
content: Passengers of an Air India flight at Delhi airport have complained they were made to sit inside the aircraft without air-conditioning on Sunday. The flight was scheduled to travel to Patna.

title: "May Hurt Bengal But...": Official On Impact Of Bangladesh Import Curbs
content: Though the Centre's move to restrict imports of certain goods from Bangladesh via land ports will have an impact on employment and transport revenue in West Bengal, the national interest is more important than the potential economic fallout.

title: 'Wife Died By Suicide, Stuffed Her In Bag Fearing Action': UP Man To Cops
content: Police found a woman's body stuffed inside a large suitcase at her residence here on Sunday after her family claimed that she had committed suicide, officials said.

title: Prashant Kishor Stopped From Entering Nitish Kumar's Ancestral Village
content: Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor was on Sunday stopped by the administration from entering Kalyan Bigha, the ancestral village of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, where he wanted to interact with locals during his visit to Nalanda district.

title: Video: Farmer's Desperate Bid To Save Crop Amid Rain, Then A Call By Union Minister
content: A farmer in Maharashtra was seen desperately trying to save his produce from being washed away in a heavy downpour in a heartbreaking video doing the rounds on social media.

title: Mayawati Appoints Nephew Akash Anand BSP's Chief National Coordinator
content: In a significant move, the Bahujan Samaj Party's (BSP) national president Mayawati appointed her nephew Akash Anand as the party's Chief National Coordinator on Sunday.

title: After Himanta Sarma's "ISI Invite" Charge, Gaurav Gogoi's "Worse Than B-Grade Film" Retort
content: The war of words between Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi escalated today after Mr Sarma said the government has evidence of the Congress leader's visit to Pakistan on an invitation from the ISI.

title: 8 Killed After Short Circuit Triggers Massive Fire At Maharashtra Factory
content: Eight persons, including three women and a child, were killed in a massive fire at a factory in Maharashtra's Solapur district on Sunday, officials said.

title: Abu Saifullah, Lashkar Terrorist Behind 3 Attacks In India, Killed In Pak
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Razaullah Nizamani alias Abu Saiullah, who was the brain behind the 2006 attack on the RSS headquarters, was killed by unidentified gunmen in Sindh province of Pakistan, officials here said.

title: "Warned Against Misuse": Sharad Pawar On Change In Anti-Money Laundering Law
content: Veteran politician Sharad Pawar said today that he had warned former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and his UPA government about the amendments in the PMLA, and the possibilities of their abuse under a different government.

title: Bangladeshi Actor, Nusraat Faria, Who Played Sheikh Hasina On Screen Arrested In Murder Case
content: Bangladeshi actress Nusraat Faria, who played the role of Bangladesh's former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in the biopic on her father, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, was arrested at Dhaka's Shahjalal International Airport.

title: "Mischievous": Congress On Centre's Snub To Its Diplomatic Outreach Nominees
content: The Congress has accused the BJP of politicising Operation Sindoor after only one of four names it suggested for all-party delegations to the international community was accepted.

title: Indian PhD Graduate Facing Deportation Wins Legal Battle To Stay In US
content: Priya Saxena, an Indian PhD student at a university in South Dakota, whom the Trump administration has been attempting to deport from the United States, has won a legal reprieve from a federal court, allowing her to stay in America.

title: How Hyderabad Building Turned Into Gas Chamber As Fire Raged
content: The death of 17 members of a family, including eight children, in a massive fire has left people shocked in Hyderabad.

title: Scheffler wins PGA for third major as Rahm fades
content: Scottie Scheffler, whose three-shot lead was erased during the final round, held steady to win the PGA Championship by five shots as Jon Rahm stumbled down the stretch.

title: OKC overcomes tough Nuggets test to make WCF
content: The Oklahoma City Thunder rolled into the Western Conference finals after beating the Nuggets 125-93 in Game 7 on Sunday.

title: Scheffler: Used new driver at PGA after failed test
content: Rory McIlroy's driver wasn't the only one the USGA deemed nonconforming in testing ahead of this week's PGA Championship -- Scottie Scheffler confirmed Sunday after his five-stroke victory that he was also forced to use a new driver for the tournament.

title: WNBA probes 'hateful' comments toward Reese
content: The WNBA is looking into allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed at Angel Reese after an incident involving Caitlin Clark and Reese in Saturday's Sky-Fever game.

title: Nuggets effusive in praise for interim Adelman
content: Nuggets interim coach David Adelman earned praise across the board for his performance during these playoffs and is considered a strong candidate to take over on a permanent basis.

title: Twins' streaks end at 13 wins, 34 shutout innings
content: Royce Lewis was robbed of a potential game-tying homer by Brewers outfielder Jackson Chourio in the eighth inning as the Twins' win streak was halted at 13 games.

title: Angel City's King: Medical team 'saved my life'
content: Angel City defender Savy King was released from the hospital Saturday, just more than a week after she collapsed on the field during a match.

title: Indy 500 rookie Shwartzman wins pole in shocker
content: Robert Shwartzman, who has dual nationality in Israel and Russia, became the first Indy 500 rookie to qualify on the pole since Teo Fabi in 1983.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Brilliant Bompastor guides Chelsea to FA Cup glory vs. Man United
content: Chelsea beat Manchester United 3-0 at Wembley Stadium to complete a clean sweep of the women's domestic honors.

title: European soccer review: Premier League's UCL race sets up final-day fireworks
content: With one matchday left, the Premier League's European race is wide open. That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Trophyless again, Arsenal need a lift despite win over Newcastle
content: Arsenal's win over Newcastle all but confirms second place, but another trophyless season is taking its toll.

title: Arteta challenges board to back him with signings
content: Mikel Arteta has challenged the Arsenal hierarchy to "do what they have to do" in the summer transfer market to turn the club into Premier League champions.

title: Chelsea beat Utd to win FA Cup, secure treble
content: Chelsea completed the treble of domestic trophies on Sunday, crushing holders Manchester United 3-0 in the women's FA Cup final at Wembley.

title: Ohanian: Chelsea can be 'America's team'
content: Alexis Ohanian said Chelsea can be "America's team" and backed the club to become "a billion-dollar franchise one day."

title: Cristiano Ronaldo Jr. nets 1st Portugal U15s goals
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's son, Cristiano Ronaldo Júnior, scored his first two goals for Portugal's U15 side in Sunday's 3-2 victory against Croatia.

title: Ajax boss emotional after historic title collapse
content: Ajax manager Francesco Farioli has said he has no regrets despite his side finishing as runners-up in the Eredivisie in one of the biggest title collapses in history.

title: Vardy scores 200th Leicester goal in farewell game
content: Jamie Vardy scored his 200th goal for Leicester City on his final appearance for the club in Sunday's Premier League clash against Ipswich Town.

title: Sources: Frimpong set for Liverpool medical
content: Right wing-back Jeremie Frimpong is set to undergo a medical at Liverpool this week as he closes in a move from Bayer Leverkusen, sources have told ESPN.

title: Everton win to give Goodison Park fitting farewell
content: Everton gave Goodison Park a fitting farewell after Iliman Ndiaye scored twice to give the home side a 2-0 victory over already-relegated Southampton.

title: Was Imola a one-off or is Verstappen now a title contender?
content: Red Bull have taken a step forward, which means Max Verstappen's win might be a sign of things to come.

title: Morales puts division on notice with TKO of Burns
content: Michael Morales stamped himself as a real threat in the welterweight division with an impressive TKO.

title: From the Rolling Stones to Drake: Each time Barcelona has rocked an artist's logo on its kit
content: Since Barcelona and Spotify agreed to a sponsorship deal in March 2022, they have collaborated on a few firsts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Brazil clubs eye Ronaldo for Club World Cup
content: Will Cristiano Ronaldo be suiting up at the Club World Cup in June? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Early look at the Stars-Oilers matchup in the Western Conference finals
